member.summary: Specifies the elevation type for a Windows user.

member.summary: The token does not have a linked token (standard user, elevation requires credentials from an administrative user account).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ElevationType.Full
member.summary: The token is an elevated token (integrity level is high or above).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ElevationType.Limited
member.summary: The token is a limited token (integrity level is medium, but the user is a local administrator and can elevate with consent).

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.FriendlySizeNameType
member.summary: Specifies the display format for the class.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FriendlySizeNameType.Unit
member.summary:
Specifies, that the closest unit (Bytes, KB, MB, GB, TB, ...) is displayed. The result is rounded with no decimal places.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FriendlySizeNameType.UnitTwoDigits
member.summary:
Specifies, that the closest unit (Bytes, KB, MB, GB, TB, ...) is displayed. The result is rounded with two decimal places.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12,06 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FriendlySizeNameType.Bytes
member.summary:
Specifies, that the exact amount of bytes is displayed. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12.345 bytes"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FriendlySizeNameType.KiloBytes
member.summary:
Specifies, that the value is displayed as kilobytes. The result is rounded up. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "13 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FriendlySizeNameType.KiloBytesTwoDigits
member.summary:
Specifies, that the value is displayed as kilobytes. The result is rounded with two decimal places. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "13 KB"

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format for a .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Default
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits.
Example: 00000000000000000000000000000000

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Hyphens
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens.
Example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Braces
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in braces.
Example: {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Parentheses
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses.
Example: (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Hexadecimal
member.summary:
The is displayed with four hexadecimal values enclosed in braces, where the fourth value is a subset of eight hexadecimal values that is also enclosed in braces.
Example: {0x00000000,0x0000,0x0000,{0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00}}

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.HashType
member.summary: Specifies a hash algorithm.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.Adler32
member.summary:
The Adler-32 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "00000001".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.CRC32
member.summary:
The CRC32 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "00000000".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.CRC64
member.summary:
The CRC64 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "0000000000000000".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.MD5
member.summary:
The MD5 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.RIPEMD160
member.summary:
The RIPEMD-160 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "9c1185a5c5e9fc54612808977ee8f548b2258d31".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA1
member.summary:
The SHA-1 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "da39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA256
member.summary:
The SHA-256 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA384
member.summary:
The SHA-384 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "38b060a751ac96384cd9327eb1b1e36a21fdb71114be07434c0cc7bf63f6e1da274edebfe76f65fbd51ad2f14898b95b".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA512
member.summary:
The SHA-512 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "cf83e1357eefb8bdf1542850d66d8007d620e4050b5715dc83f4a921d36ce9ce47d0d13c5d85f2b0ff8318d2877eec2f63b931bd47417a81a538327af927da3e".

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.DateTimeExtensions.AddBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that adds the specified number of business days to this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are added, otherwise days are subtracted.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be added to this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the sum of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.DateTimeExtensions.SubtractBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that subtracts the specified number of business days from this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are subtracted, otherwise days are added.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be subtracted from this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the difference of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.DateTimeExtensions.GetTotalBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Computes the total count of business days between two instances. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The time fraction is ignored and the returned value is inclusive.
Example 1: Friday through Tuesday = 3 business days
Example 2: Saturday through Sunday = 0 business days
member.param: The value to compare to .
The value to compare to this . can be either less or greater than this value.
member.returns: A value representing the total count of business days between two instances.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator
member.summary: Represents a performance counter for progress calculations, typically binary transfers (file transferring, downloads, ...)

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the total progress. This is typically the amount of transferred bytes in a binary transfer operation.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the expected maximum value. This is typically the total size in bytes in a binary transfer operation. If is , values calculated based on it will also be . This is useful for display of an indeterminate status of progress bars.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.MeasureTimeSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval in which is measured. The event is raised in the approximate interval of this value, however only after has changed.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Progress
member.summary: Gets a ? value indicating the progress. This value is between 0.0 and 1.0, if is in bounds of 0.0 and .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.ProgressPercentage
member.summary: Gets a ? value indicating the progress in percent. This value is between 0.0 and 100.0, if is in bounds of 0.0 and .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Difference
member.summary: Gets the difference of the property between the last two measurements.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.DifferencePerSecond
member.summary: Gets the difference of the property between the last two measurements, interpolated to one second based on .

member.name: E:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the property changed.

member.name: E:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Measured
member.summary: Occurs when the property changed and the interval specified in has been reached.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with no maximum value and a measurement interval of 1 second.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified maximum value and a measurement interval of 1 second.
member.param: A value indicating the maximum expected value for .

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified maximum value and the specified measurement interval.
member.param: A value indicating the maximum expected value for .
A value indicating the interval in which to measure the progress.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Gets or sets the caption for message boxes shown by the method. The initial value is "Information".

member.summary: Gets or sets the caption for message boxes shown by the method. The initial value is "Confirmation".

member.summary: Gets or sets the caption for message boxes shown by the method. The initial value is "Warning".

member.summary: Gets or sets the caption for message boxes shown by the method. The initial value is "Error".

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.MessageBoxes.Information(System.String)
member.summary: Shows a dialog with the specified message, using as title and an "OK" button. The title is a static value, set to "Information" by default.
member.param: A specifying the message to be displayed.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.MessageBoxes.Confirmation(System.String)
member.summary: Shows a dialog with the specified message, using as title and "Yes" and "No" buttons. The title is a static value, set to "Confirmation" by default.
member.param: A specifying the message to be displayed.
member.returns: , if "Yes" has been selected; otherwise, .

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.MessageBoxes.Confirmation(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shows a dialog with the specified message, using as title and "Yes" and "No" buttons. The title is a static value, set to "Confirmation" by default.
